intro: Papaver alpinum subvar. subminiatum, commonly known as the alpine poppy, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Alps and surrounding mountain ranges. It is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Due to its beauty and rarity, it is often cultivated in alpine gardens and protected areas.
